      • isPurePaintingMode

        public boolean isPurePaintingMode()
        Specified by:
        isPurePaintingMode in interface EditorEx
        Returns:
        current 'pure painting mode' status
        See Also:
        EditorEx.setPurePaintingMode(boolean)

      • setPurePaintingMode

        public void setPurePaintingMode(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        We often re-use the logic encapsulated at the editor. For example, every time we show editor fragment (folding, preview etc) we create a dedicated graphics object and ask the editor to paint into it.

        The thing is that the editor itself may change its state if any postponed operation is triggered by the painting request (e.g. soft wraps recalculation is triggered by the paint request and newly calculated soft wraps cause caret to change its position).

        This method allows to inform the editor that all subsequent painting request should not change the editor state.

        In 'pure painting mode' editor also behaves as if soft wraps were not enabled.

        Specified by:
        setPurePaintingMode in interface EditorEx
        Parameters:
        enabled - 'pure painting mode' status to use

      • registerLineExtensionPainter

        public void registerLineExtensionPainter(java.util.function.IntFunction<java.util.Collection<LineExtensionInfo>> lineExtensionPainter)
        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        Registers a function which will be applied to a line number to obtain additional text fragments. The fragments returned by the function will be drawn in the editor after end of the line (together with fragments returned by EditorLinePainter extensions).
        Specified by:
        registerLineExtensionPainter in interface EditorEx

      • processLineExtensions

                                     Processor<? super LineExtensionInfo> processor)

      • registerScrollBarRepaintCallback

        public void registerScrollBarRepaintCallback(ButtonlessScrollBarUI.ScrollbarRepaintCallback callback)
        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        Allows to register a callback that will be called one each repaint of the editor vertical scrollbar. This is needed to allow a parent component draw above the scrollbar components (e.g. in the merge tool), otherwise the drawings are cleared once the scrollbar gets repainted (which may happen suddenly, because the scrollbar UI uses the Animator to draw itself.
        Specified by:
        registerScrollBarRepaintCallback in interface EditorEx
        Parameters:
        callback - callback which will be called from the JComponent.paint(Graphics) method of the editor vertical scrollbar.

      • getExpectedCaretOffset

        public int getExpectedCaretOffset()
        Specified by:
        getExpectedCaretOffset in interface EditorEx
        Returns:
        the offset that the caret is expected to be but maybe not yet. This can be used in EditorMouseListener.mousePressed(EditorMouseEvent) implementation, as at the time this method is invoked caret wasn't yet moved to the press position. In other circumstances it's just equal to primary caret's offset.

        public void setContextMenuGroupId(java.lang.String groupId)
        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        Sets id of action group what will be used to construct context menu displayed by default editor popup handler on mouse right button's click (with null value disabling context menu). This method might have no effect if default editor's popup handler was overridden using EditorEx.installPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler).
        Specified by:

        See Also:

        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        Returns id of action group what will be used to construct context menu displayed by default editor popup handler on mouse right button's click (null value meaning no context menu). Returned value might be meaningless if default editor's popup handler was overridden using EditorEx.installPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler).
        Specified by:
        getContextMenuGroupId in interface EditorEx
        See Also:
        EditorEx.setContextMenuGroupId(String)

      • installPopupHandler

        public void installPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler popupHandler)
        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        Allows to override default editor's context popup logic.

        Default handler shows a context menu corresponding to a certain action group registered in ActionManager. Group's id can be changed using EditorEx.setContextMenuGroupId(String). For inline custom visual elements (inlays) action group is determined by EditorCustomElementRenderer.getContextMenuGroupId(Inlay) and EditorCustomElementRenderer.getContextMenuGroup(Inlay).

        If multiple handlers are installed, they are processed in order, starting from the most recently installed one. Processing stops when some handler returns true from EditorPopupHandler.handlePopup(EditorMouseEvent) method.

        Specified by:
        installPopupHandler in interface EditorEx
        See Also:
        EditorEx.uninstallPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler)

      • uninstallPopupHandler

        public void uninstallPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler popupHandler)
        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        Removes previously installed EditorPopupHandler.
        Specified by:
        uninstallPopupHandler in interface EditorEx
        See Also:
        EditorEx.installPopupHandler(EditorPopupHandler)

      • setCustomCursor

        public void setCustomCursor(java.lang.Object requestor,
                            java.awt.Cursor cursor)
        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        If cursor parameter value is not null, sets custom cursor to editor's content component, otherwise restores default editor cursor management logic (requestor parameter value should be the same in both setting and restoring requests). 'Restoring' call for a requestor, which hasn't set a cursor previously, has no effect. If multiple requestors have currently set custom cursors, one of them will be used (it is unspecified, which one).
        Specified by:
        setCustomCursor in interface EditorEx

      • getMarkupModel

        public MarkupModelEx getMarkupModel()
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Returns the markup model for the editor. This model contains editor-specific highlighters (for example, highlighters added by "Highlight usages in file"), which are painted in addition to the highlighters contained in the markup model for the document.

        See also DocumentMarkupModel.forDocument(Document, Project, boolean) EditorEx.getFilteredDocumentMarkupModel().

        Specified by:
        getMarkupModel in interface Editor
        Specified by:
        getMarkupModel in interface EditorEx
        Returns:
        the markup model instance.

      • getFilteredDocumentMarkupModel

        public MarkupModelEx getFilteredDocumentMarkupModel()
        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        Returns the markup model for the underlying Document.

        This model differs from the one from DocumentMarkupModel#forDocument, as it does not contain highlighters that should not be visible in this Editor. (for example, debugger breakpoints in a diff viewer editors)

        Specified by:
        getFilteredDocumentMarkupModel in interface EditorEx
        Returns:
        the markup model instance.
        See Also:
        MarkupEditorFilter, setHighlightingFilter(Condition), DocumentMarkupModel.forDocument(Document, Project, boolean)

        public java.awt.Point offsetToXY(int offset,

                                 boolean beforeSoftWrap)
        Specified by:

        See Also:

      • offsetToVisualPosition

        public VisualPosition offsetToVisualPosition(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Maps an offset in the document to visual position.

        It's assumed that original position is associated with the character immediately preceding given offset, leansRight value for visual position will be determined correspondingly.

        If there's a soft wrap at the given offset, visual position on a line following the wrap will be returned.

        Specified by:
        offsetToVisualPosition in interface Editor
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset in the document.
        Returns:
        the corresponding visual position.

      • offsetToVisualPosition

        public VisualPosition offsetToVisualPosition(int offset,
                                             boolean leanForward,
                                             boolean beforeSoftWrap)
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Maps an offset in the document to visual position.
        Specified by:
        offsetToVisualPosition in interface Editor
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset in the document.
        leanForward - if true, original position is associated with character after given offset, if false - with character before given offset. This can make a difference in bidirectional text (see LogicalPosition, VisualPosition)
        beforeSoftWrap - if true, visual position at line preceeding the wrap will be returned, otherwise - visual position at line following the wrap.
        Returns:
        the corresponding visual position.

      • offsetToVisualColumnInFoldRegion

      • offsetToLogicalPosition

        public LogicalPosition offsetToLogicalPosition(int offset)
        Description copied from interface: Editor
        Maps an offset in the document to a logical position.

        It's assumed that original position is associated with character immediately preceding given offset, so target logical position will have leansForward value set to false.

        Specified by:
        offsetToLogicalPosition in interface Editor
        Parameters:
        offset - the offset in the document.
        Returns:
        the corresponding logical position.

      • isStickySelection

        public boolean isStickySelection()
        Description copied from interface: EditorEx
        Allows to answer if 'sticky selection' is active for the current editor.

        'Sticky selection' means that every time caret position changes, selection end offset is automatically set to the same position. Selection start is always caret offset on EditorEx.setStickySelection(boolean) call with 'true' argument.

        Specified by:
        isStickySelection in interface EditorEx
        Returns:
        true if 'sticky selection' mode is active at the current editor; false otherwise

      • setStickySelection

        Specified by:
        setStickySelection in interface EditorEx
        Parameters:
        enable - flag that identifies if 'sticky selection' mode should be enabled
